bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Photographer Jim Hanna specializes in presenting images of rural America. Motivated by the example of his father, an amateur photographer who used his skills to earn extra income during the Second World War, Hanna has turned his gift into a form of visual communication, preserving the isolated countryside before it transforms into an urban example of society.

In addition to his father, Hanna attributes influence by such artists as Arnold Newman (1918-2006), Edward Steichen (1879-1973), Eliot Porter (1901-1990) and Edward Curtis (1868-1952), who are known for focusing on environmental and cultural subjects. Drawing on these sources for guidance, Hanna captures images of disappearing virgin territory and people that compose a workforce of manual labor.

Hanna lives in Purcellville, Virginia, and frequently returns to western Loudoun County for subject material. He showcases his work in juried art exhibits as well as his Web site, www.jimhannaphotography.com. Jim Hanna Photography, LLC was established in 2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection is a range of 8x10 digital prints, subject, "Thomas Balch Library," from two separate shoots. Photographer Jim Hanna donated his time, photographic skills and finished product to Thomas Balch Library for library publicity purposes.
The content of this collection is 9 digital photos, 1 CD and 9 prints.
